title: David Tetteh (boxer)
text: David "Little Tyson" Tetteh (born 5 July 1971 in <a href="Accra">Accra</a>) is a <a href="Ghanaian%20people">Ghanaian</a> <a href="professional">professional</a> <a href="lightweight">light</a>/<a href="light%20welterweight">light welter</a>/<a href="welterweight">welterweight</a> <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> of the 1990s and 2000s who won the Ghanaian lightweight title, African Boxing Union lightweight title, and <a href="List%20of%20Commonwealth%20Boxing%20Council%20Champions%23Lightweight">Commonwealth lightweight title</a>, and was a challenger for the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Organization">World Boxing Organization</a> (WBO) <a href="North%20American%20Boxing%20Organization">North American Boxing Organization</a> (NABO) lightweight title against <a href="Harold%20Warren">Harold Warren</a>, his professional fighting weight varied from , i.e. <a href="lightweight">lightweight</a> to , i.e. <a href="welterweight">welterweight</a>.
